thig6.2:2.2: at the side of a road, or in a cemetery.
thig6.2:3.2: and I saw the one faring well,
thig6.2:3.4: NOTE: 'akutobhaya' = 'a (non) kuto (from where) bhaya (fear)' = "no fear from anywhere" = "fearless everywhere".
thig6.2:4.2: I paid respects and sat down.
thig6.2:5.3: I pushed myself to practice in accordance...
thig6.2:5.4: I realized the path of joy.
thig6.2:6.1: [I think here soka is more general, she has cut off all woes, including grief] NOTE: Below you translated soka as 'sorrow', here as 'woes' (and elsewhere you used other words, like 'grief'). The inconsistency!
thig6.2:6.3: Now I have fully understood how grief comes into being.
